entry.title: Employee returns from LOA during Manager's LOA, manager fields not updated by the next level manager
entry.content:
Hi, 

when employees come back from LOA and their managers are still in LOA, the field "manager" in job info is blank' The next level manager name is removed after the actual return date. How to make sure in this scenario that the field is populated by the next level manager?

thanks in advance for your help!

Sevda

entry.title: Mastering Global Assignments: Setting FTE to Zero in SuccessFactors Employee Central
entry.content:
Mastering Global Assignments: Setting FTE to Zero in SuccessFactors Employee Central

 

The Global Assignment (GA) functionality in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central is crucial for managing international mobility. A common configuration challenge is correctly reflecting the employee’s status and headcount (FTE) in their original, home country while they are away.

This guide outlines the standard best practice for handling an employee moving from a Home Location (e.g., India) to a Host Location (e.g., US), ensuring the Home Job Information accurately shows an FTE of 0 and zero Standard Working Hours.

 

1. Understanding the Global Assignment Framework

 

When an employee starts a Global Assignment, SuccessFactors creates two separate, linked employments:

  1. Home Assignment (India): The original, primary employment record. This record must be updated to a "dormant" status.

  2. Host Assignment (US): The new, secondary employment created for the duration of the GA, where the employee is actively working.

 

Configuration Goal

 

The goal is to ensure that the Home Assignment (India) record is marked as inactive, using an appropriate Event Reason, and has both the FTE and Standard Working Hours explicitly set to 0 from the effective date of the GA.

Conversely, the Host Assignment (US) record will maintain the actual working details (e.g., $1.0$ FTE and $40$ Standard Working Hours).

 

2. Key Event Reasons for GA Management

 

To correctly trigger the status and FTE change, you must identify and use the specific Event Reasons configured for the GA process.

Assignment StatusEventRecommended Event Reason CodeEmployee StatusPurpose
Home (Away)Away on Global AssignmentAGA (Away on Global Assignment)DormantTriggers FTE/Hours to 0 on the Home Record.
Home (Return)Back from Global AssignmentBGA (Back from Global Assignment)ActiveTriggers FTE/Hours back to standard (e.g., $1.0$/$40$ hrs) on the Home Record.

Pro Tip: Confirm these exact codes (e.g., AGA, BGA) by checking the Global Assignment Configuration object in Manage Data or the Event Reason codes in Manage Organization, Pay and Job Structures.

 

3. Implementing the Business Rule for FTE = 0

 

The most efficient way to enforce the zero FTE and hours is by implementing a Business Rule on the Job Information element.

 

Step 3a: Create the Business Rule

 

Create an onSave rule scenario on the Job Information Base Object:

SettingValue/Selection
Rule ScenarioTrigger Changes to HRIS Elements / Job Information
Base ObjectJob Information
Rule NameSet_FTE_Zero_For_GA_Home

 

Rule Logic (Pseudo-Code)

 

IF
  Job Information.Event Reason IS EQUAL TO <AGA Code> (Away on Global Assignment)
THEN
  Set Job Information.FTE TO 0
  Set Job Information.Standard Working Hours TO 0
ELSE IF
  Job Information.Event Reason IS EQUAL TO <BGA Code> (Back from Global Assignment)
THEN
  Set Job Information.FTE TO 1.0 (or standard home FTE)
  Set Job Information.Standard Working Hours TO 40 (or standard home hours)

 

Step 3b: Assign the Business Rule

 

The rule must be assigned to the Job Information element to execute when the system records the GA event.

  1. Navigate to Manage Business Configuration (BCUI).

  2. Select the jobInfo HRIS element.

  3. Assign your rule (Set_FTE_Zero_For_GA_Home) as an onSave rule.

 

Summary of the Global Assignment Flow

 

EventRecord AffectedEvent ReasonRule ActionResult
Start GAHome (India)AGARule TriggersFTE & Hours set to 0
Start GAHost (US)ADD GAN/AActive FTE & Hours set
End GAHome (India)BGARule TriggersFTE & Hours set back to Standard
End GAHost (US)End GAN/AEmployment record terminated

By setting up this configuration, you ensure accurate headcount reporting: the FTE moves entirely from the Home entity to the Host entity for the duration of the global assignment, maintaining data integrity across the organization.

entry.title: SuccessFactors Sales Performance Module
entry.content:
Driving Revenue Excellence with SAP Sales Performance Management

In today’s competitive landscape, organizations are increasingly relying on intelligent tools to optimize sales performance and align sales teams with business objectives. The SAP Sales Performance Management (SPM) module empowers companies to design, manage, and analyze their sales strategies with precision.

1. What is SAP SPM?
SAP SPM is an integrated solution that automates and streamlines key processes such as sales incentive management, territory and quota planning, and performance analytics. By eliminating manual processes and data silos, it ensures that sales teams stay motivated and aligned with company goals.

2. Core Capabilities:

  • Incentive Compensation Management: Automate commission calculations, ensure transparency, and reduce payment disputes.

  • Territory and Quota Planning: Optimize sales coverage and set achievable, data-driven quotas.

  • Analytics and Insights: Monitor performance in real time with dashboards that drive accountability and improvement.

3. Business Impact:
Organizations using SAP SPM report improved sales productivity, higher motivation, and faster decision-making. Integrating the module with SAP SuccessFactors or SAP CX solutions further enhances end-to-end visibility — from people performance to customer success.

4. The Future of Sales Enablement:
With built-in AI and predictive analytics, SAP SPM is evolving beyond automation to provide foresight — helping leaders forecast trends, identify performance gaps, and model the impact of incentive plan changes before implementation.

In summary, SAP Sales Performance Management transforms sales operations into a data-driven, transparent, and motivating ecosystem — driving both top-line growth and team engagement.

entry.title: How to set a field to filter people in directory search based on their skills? (SAP SF)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I need the following to be set in the system:  directory searach should have a custom field (as on a screen), that allows to filter based on skills of employees, that are entered in growth portfolio of employees. 

 

However, I struggle to understand, what settings I need to set for the custom field, that I choose in "custom filters" to add the field in directory search. 

There are 2 main issues for me:
1) Skills do not come from picklists
2) There are no field, that include skills in HRIS elements. 

Because of that I am not sure how this customization is supposed to be done.

entry.title: Validation for only employee without allowance is able to submit transportation claim in Concur
entry.content:
Hi All FI, SuccessFactors, and Concur Experts.

If we may know,
currently there is an inquiry from the end-user about the feasibility of set-up a kind of validation or restriction rule to only employee that receive "monthly transport allowance" will not be able to submit "taxi/transportation charges" claim via SAP Concur system.

Would you like to kindly help us on giving advice whether there is any specific technical field or information that we could use as such an indicator to know which personel number of employee that receive "monthly transport allowance" in SAP FI or SAP SuccessFactors? to be further integrated or acknowledged (captured) by the Concur system then.

Thank you so much, and we are looking forward to discussing this with you.

Ani.

@RafaelMira @Ronak_Jhuthawat @ctf_jacqting @Michaela_Sedlicka @LeoSupriano @katharina_sorge @yogeshgsalvi @harinarasimha @siddharthrajora 

SAP S/4HANA integration with SAP Concur solutions SAP Concur SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central integration to SAP Business Suite HCM (Human Capital Management) FIN Travel Management

entry.title: Header and Footer in Standard Emai Notification
entry.content:
Hi EC experts,

I have a query regarding the header and footer in standard email notifications.

I configured the HTML code for the header and footer in the email notification template, and during the demo, it reflected correctly in the standard emails. However, when I applied the same configuration in the client’s test instance, the header and footer are not appearing as expected.

Could you please help me understand why the header and footer are not reflecting in the client instance?

entry.title: I had hired one new employee in EC but that user is not coming under DRM, it is showing no data
Education Reimbursement via Custom MDF
entry.content:
Hi,

  We would like to create custom MDF for Education Reimbursement so employee can submit claim details - Child Details and Reimbursement Item details with amount. Then the amount will be added up and logic is there to find the approved amount. Question is what should be the Effective Dating of this MDF.  If we keep basic, user can create only one claim and has to wait till it is approved. If we keep it as none, and has a parent and child, the child object will be keep on piling up. How exactly should the MDF be configured so employee can submit multiple claims i.e one claim per child.

Thanks

Sri

entry.title: Contingent Worker to Employee Hire
entry.content: Our consultants have provided a solution for the Contingent Worker to Hire where they have forced the Contingent Worker profile to change into an Employee, retaining the CW ID and creating a new 'employee id' for the live profile. Then in the live profile there is a toggle between the CW profile and Employee profile, hard linking them. i am uncomfortable with the solution for a number of reasons but wanted to reach out to the community to see what feedback the SAP community may have.

entry.title: [2H 2025] PMU-25823 - Enhancements to Business Rules, Scenarios, Contexts, and Functions
entry.content:

Or is there a different naming on this under Configure Business Rule?

Thank you very much!

Best Regards,

Gelo

entry.title: [2H2025] KM-21299 - New Administrator Help Frameworks Query
entry.content:
Hello,

Regarding this change, just for further checking on how can a specific user be identified as a system administrator in the system automatically? 

We have set permission for ONB administrators, Compensation administrators, but how is the system identifying in general who are the administrators in the system? Like who will have the view to the New Administrator Help Frameworks Query? Just for validation.

Thank you in advance for those who will answer my query.

Best Regards,

Gelo

entry.title: Looking for an ATS practitioner for a short expert interview (Bachelor’s thesis)
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently writing my Bachelor’s thesis on the impact of Artificial Intelligence on the early selection phase of corporate recruitment processes. A key part of my research focuses on Applicant Tracking Systems and how they support the analysis, matching and ranking of applications.

For this purpose, I am looking for a practitioner with hands-on experience using or administering an ATS such as SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting. I would like to conduct a short expert interview (approximately 45 minutes), which will focus on practical insights into the use of such systems. No confidential company information is required, and all interviews will be fully anonymised in my thesis.

Since my academic work is written in German, the interview itself would also need to be conducted in German. If anyone here is able to support this or knows a suitable contact, I would be very grateful. I will gladly provide a short description of the research topic and interview framework upon request.

Thank you very much in advance, and kind regards,

Edgar

entry.title: Dependent information
entry.content:
Hi Team,

I have written a rule to hide marital status field/second nationality/nationality/attachment etc from personal information that appears in dependent information portlet.

While marital status and nationality field is getting hidden by the rule (trace) and reflected in UI, second nationality/attachment field continues to appear in UI, even though the trace says that visibility is set to none.

Can someone through some light.. The latest people profile is activated.-FYI.

Thanks

Mitra

entry.content: I am trying to identify why the position, job, and organizational unit data from SuccessFactors are not integrating into ECP. The records are not being updated. Could you please advise me on where I can identify the root cause of this issue?
